etymologies: mid 19th century: shortening of faraday. The term was originally proposed as a unit of electrical charge

definitions: the SI unit of electrical capacitance, equal to the capacitance of a capacitor in which one coulomb of charge causes a potential difference of one volt.
shortDefinitions: SI unit of electrical capacitance, equal to capacitance of capacitor in which one coulomb of charge causes potential difference of one volt
